meanings.def: an offer by a person or a company to pay a particular amount of money for something
examples: bid for something A German firm launched a takeover bid for the company.
At the auction (= a public sale where things are sold to the person who offers the most), the highest bid for the picture was £200.
bid on something (North American English also) the highest bid on the picture
Any more bids?
I placed a bid on a repossessed Ferrari.
He made a cash bid for the company.
They have invited bids for the property.
They blocked a $24 million bid by a rival company.

meanings.def: an offer to do work or provide a service for a particular price, in competition with other companies, etc.
examples: The company submitted a bid for the contract to clean the hospital.

meanings.def: an effort to do something or to obtain something
examples: bid for something a bid for power
bid to do something a desperate bid to escape from his attackers
He attacked his guards in a desperate bid for freedom.
This play was her last bid for recognition.
It was a bid by the president to boost his popularity.
They failed in their bid to buy the company.

meanings.def: a statement of the number of points a player thinks they will win
to offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an auction
examples: bid (something) (for something) I bid £2 000 for the painting.
bid (against somebody) (for something) We wanted to buy the chairs but another couple were bidding against us.
Two dealers bid against each other for the antique table.

meanings.def: to offer to do work or provide a service for a particular price, in competition with other companies, etc.
examples: bid for something A French firm will be bidding for the contract.
bid on something (North American English also) A French firm will be bidding on the contract.
bid to do something Which other cities are bidding to host the 2028 Olympics?

meanings.def: to try to do, get or achieve something
examples: The team is bidding to retain its place in the league.

meanings.def: (in some card games) to say how many points you expect to win
examples: She bid four hearts.

meanings.def: used by an auctioneer who is selling something
examples: What am I bid for this vase?

idioms.def: used by an auctioneer who is selling something
examples: What am I bid for this vase?

meanings.def: to say ‘good morning’, etc. to somebody
examples: I bade farewell to all the friends I had made in Paris.
I bade all my friends farewell.
He bade farewell to the city where he had been so happy.
He bade her good day and left.

meanings.def: to tell somebody to do something
examples: He bade me come closer.
